I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

subcode_sss_terminates_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 ↓ -> P // st1 ↓
in_sss_step : forall (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (st1 st2 : state), fst st1 = k + length l -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (k, l ++ i :: r) // st1 :1> st2
subcode_sss_compute_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 st3 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st3 -> P // st1 -> > st3
sss_step = fun (P : code) (st1 st2 : state) => exists (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (d : data), P = (k, l ++ i :: r) /\ st1 = (k + length l, d) /\ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 : code -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_stall = fun (ii : instr) (st : state) => forall st' : state, ~ st ⟬ ii ⦒ st' : instr -> state -> Prop
sss_step_fun : forall (P : code) (s t1 t2 : state), P // s :1> t1 -> P // s :1> t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (P : code) (ii : instr) (st st' : state), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> P // st :1> st' -> st ⟬ ii ⦒ st'
sss_steps_fun : forall (P : code) (k : nat) (s t1 t2 : state), P//s-[k] -> t1 -> P//s-[k] -> t2 -> t1 = t2
in_out_code : forall (X : Type) (i : nat) (P : subcode.code X), in_code i P -> out_code i P -> False
sss_out_step_stall : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (st : state), out_code (fst st) P -> sss_step_stall P st
subcode_out_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> out_code i Q -> out_code i P
sss_steps_sind : forall (P : code) (P0 : nat -> state -> state -> SProp), (forall st : state, P0 0 st st) -> (forall (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n]->st3 -> P0 n st2 st3 -> P0 (S n) st1 st3) -> forall (n : nat) (p p0 : state), P//p-[n] -> p0 -> P0 n p p0
sss_steps_ind : forall (P : code) (P0 : nat -> state -> state -> Prop), (forall st : state, P0 0 st st) -> (forall (n : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), P // st1 :1> st2 -> P//st2-[n]->st3 -> P0 n st2 st3 -> P0 (S n) st1 st3) -> forall (n : nat) (p p0 : state), P//p-[n] -> p0 -> P0 n p p0
ZifyClasses.and_morph : forall s1 s2 t1 t2 : Prop, s1 < -> t1 -> s2 < -> t2 -> s1 /\ s2 < -> t1 /\ t2
sss_stall_step_0 : forall (ii : instr) (P : code) (q : nat) (st st' : state), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall ii st -> P//st-[q] -> st' -> q = 0 /\ st = st'
sss_progress = fun (P : code) (st1 st2 : state) => exists k : nat, 0 < k /\ P//st1-[k] -> st2 : code -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_step_supcode : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st st' : state), P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st) P -> Q // st :1> st' -> P // st :1> st'
sss_output = fun (P : code) (st st' : state) => P // st -> > st' /\ out_code (fst st') P : code -> state -> state -> Prop
subcode_sss_compute_linstr : forall (k : nat) (li : list instr) (P : code) (st1 st2 st : state), (fst st1, li)//st1-[k] -> st2 -> (fst st1, li) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st -> P // st1 -> > st
subcode_in_code : forall (X : Type) (P : subcode.code X) (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> in_code i P -> in_code i Q
subcode_sss_step_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st1 st2 : state), P <sc Q -> in_code (fst st1) P -> Q // st1 :1> st2 -> P // st1 :1> st2

``` 
intros instr data one_step sss_fun sss_dec k P st' st Hout Hin.
intros Hstep.
pose proof subcode_sss_terminates_instr as Hterm.
pose proof subcode_sss_compute_instr as Hcompute.
apply Hterm in Hstep; auto.
apply Hcompute in Hstep; auto.
destruct Hstep as [Hk [Hout' _]].
split; auto.
apply sss_stall_step_0 with (P:=P) (ii:=fst st) (q:=k); auto.
```

original: intros instr data one_step sss_fun sss_dec k P st' st Hout Hin. intros Hstep. pose proof subcode_sss_terminates_instr as Hterm. pose proof subcode_sss_compute_instr as Hcompute. apply Hterm in Hstep; auto. apply Hcompute in Hstep; auto. destruct Hstep as [Hk [Hout' _]]. split; auto. apply sss_stall_step_0 with (P:=P) (ii:=fst st) (q:=k); auto.
